> A data structure that copies and re-orders data or contains pointers to data to improve the speed of data retrieval operations, often at the cost of speed for write operations. #QuizQuestion #DP900 #Definition

Most [[Relational]] database management systems (RDMSs) support clustered and nonclustered indexes. The difference is that a table is physically sorted in clustered index order when it is used and a nonclustered index does not change the table order, but it contains pointers to the appropriate table rows." #Fact
> "An index is the structure used to sort value to help optimize query performance." #QuizQuestion #DP900
Source: [Views - Azure Data Explorer | Microsoft Docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/schema-entities/views)
Accessed: [[April 19th, 2022]]
> "A view is a virtual table whose contents is defined through a query." #Definition
A simple view might look like the following:

```[[SQL]]
CREATE VIEW CustLabels
AS
SELECT c.CustomerNumber, c.CustomerName
FROM Customer c```
This would create a view that includes CustomerNumber and CustomerNamecolumn values. Once created, a view can be used as a data source on other [[Queries]].
>  "BLANK is a virtual table whose contents is defined through a query." #QuizQuestion #DP900

title: describe and compare PaaS, IaaS, and SaaS solutions

children.string: Source: [Azure [[SQL]] Database – Managed Cloud Database Service | Microsoft Azure](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/products/azure-[[SQL]]/database/#features)
Accessed: [[April 19th, 2022]]

> "Azure [[SQL]] Database is a fully managed [[Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS)]] database engine in the cloud that handles most of the database management functions such as upgrading, patching, backups, and monitoring without user involvement." #Definition #AZ900
You should use Azure [[SQL]] Database for inventory management and finance and accounting system workloads, because Azure [[SQL]] Database provides high data integrity and normalized schema. #UseCase

To connect to a [[Relational]] data service from corporate network, the following port should be open for outbound traffic: 1433.Your network firewall should allow communication over these ports to be able to connect to these [[Relational]] data services. #Fact

"An indirect relationship between data elements in a database. The rule is essentially that A is a [[Transitive Dependency]] of C (A->C) if A is functionally dependent on B (A->B), and B is functionally dependent on C (B->C) but not on A (B not->A)." #Definition

"Social security number is a transitive dependency of date-of-birth (SSN->DOB), because social security number is dependent on employee name (SSN->EMP), and employee name is dependent on date-of-birth (EMP->DOB) but not on social security number (there may be more than one John Smith or Maria Gomez)." #UseCase

"A [[[[Relational]] Database]] is a type of database that stores and provides access to data points that are related to one another. [[Relational]] [databases] are based on the [[Relational]] model, an intuitive, straightforward way of representing data in [[tables]]. In a [[[[Relational]] Database]], each row in the table is a record with a unique ID called the [[Primary Key]]. The columns of the table hold attributes of the data, and each record usually has a value for each attribute, making it easy to establish the relationships among data points." #Definition
What type of database is stored in rows and columns #QuizQuestion #DP900

"A [[Primary Key]] is a field or set of fields with values that are unique throughout a table. Values of the key can be used to refer to entire records, because each record has a different value for the key. Each table can only have one [[Primary Key]]." #Definition
What type of key is used to uniquely identify records within a table in a database? #QuizQuestion #DP900

> "Data for batch processing is collected over time, often from different data sources, and it is processed as a dataset that includes a range of rows or all rows in the dataset. Employee payroll processing and generating payroll checks
Setting inventory stocking levels based on seasonal sales volume

> " A clustered index is a data structure associated with a table that defines the order in which rows are stored on a disk." #Definition
Only one clustered index per table can be defined, because the clustered index defines how data rows are sorted and stored. #Fact
A table with an implemented clustered index is called a **clustered table**.
> " BLANK is a data structure associated with a table that defines the order in which rows are stored on a disk." #QuizQuestion #DP900
> "Partitioning is a mechanism for grouping related rows, based on a common property or [[Partition Key]]. Rows that share the same [[Partition Key]] will be stored together." #Definition
Partitions are independent from each other, and can grow or shrink as rows are added to, or removed from, a partition. A table can contain any number of partitions.

When you search for data, you can include the [[Partition Key]] in the search criteria. This helps to narrow down the volume of data to be examined, and improves performance by reducing the amount of I/O (input and output operations, or __reads__ and __writes__) needed to locate the data.
Partitioning not only helps to organize data, it can also improve scalability and performance in the following ways: #Fact
Generally you want 10s or 100s of partitions not 1000s #Fact
When creating partitions, remember that Azure Synapse already has 60 [[Distributions]] included #Fact
Ensure to take advantage of switching, merging and deletion #Fact
Avoid cross partitioning as this affects performance #Fact

Distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks are some of the largest availability and security concerns facing customers that are moving their applications to the cloud. A DDoS attack attempts to exhaust an application's resources, making the application unavailable to legitimate users. DDoS attacks can be targeted at any endpoint that is publicly reachable through the internet.
Source: [What is Azure DDoS Protection Standard? - Learn | Microsoft Docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/modules/introduction-azure-ddos-protection/2-what-is-azure-ddos-protection)
Date: [[April 28th, 2022]]

Azure DDoS Protection Standard, combined with application design best practices, provides enhanced DDoS mitigation features to defend against DDoS attacks. It is automatically tuned to help protect your specific Azure resources in a virtual network. Protection is simple to enable on any new or existing virtual network, and it requires no application or resource changes. #AZ900
Source: [Azure Key Vault availability and redundancy - Azure Key Vault | Microsoft Docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/key-vault/general/disaster-recovery-guidance)
Date: [[April 28th, 2022]]

Source: [Azure Key Vault availability and redundancy - Azure Key Vault | Microsoft Docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/key-vault/general/disaster-recovery-guidance)
Date: [[April 28th, 2022]]

Uses for this service include: Security - facial recognition can be used in building security applications, and increasingly it is used in smart phones operating systems for unlocking devices. #UseCase #QuizQuestion #AI900

Uses for this service include: Intelligent monitoring - for example, an automobile might include a system that monitors the driver's face to determine if the driver is looking at the road, looking at a mobile device, or shows signs of tiredness. #UseCase #QuizQuestion #AI900
Uses for this service include: Identity validation - useful at ports of entry kiosks where a person holds a special entry permit. #UseCase #QuizQuestion #AI900

The verify operation takes face and determines if it belongs to the same person as another face. You need to detect face(s) in an image using the Detect API. The Verify operation can then compare two faces.
The Find Similar operation takes a face you have detected and extracts faces that look alike from a list of faces that you provide. Find Similar returns a subset of the faces in the list.

The Group operation creates several smaller groups from a list of faces based on the similarities of the faces. The Group operation needs between two and 1000 faces. You should not use the Group operation to evaluate two faces. You should use Verify to evaluate two faces.

The Identify operation takes one or more face(s) and matches them to people. The Identify operation returns a list of possible matches with a confidence score between 0 and 1, with 1 being the most confident. You should not use the Identify operation to evaluate whether two faces belong to the same person.

Data shaping involves cleaning, shaping, and re-organising data in(to) tabular format. #DP900 #PL300 #Definition
A first step is often to identify headers and column names and [[Promote headers]].
You can [[Rename columns]] and [[Rename rows]] either by right-clicking the column header for a contextual menu, or double clicking the header.
You can [[Remove columns]] and [[remove rows]] to reduce the size of your imported data tables and achieve [[Normalization]].
[[Pivot]] turns distinct row values into columns - or a vertical format into horizontal.
[[Unpivot]] turns column into distinct rows.
[[Transpose]] performs a similar role to [[Pivot]] and [[Unpivot]], but does not recognise repeated values and collapse them into a single/row or column, rather preserving duplicates.
Data profiling allows you to assess the content and quality of your data, including null values, data errors, and statistics on the distribution of values within the data. #PL300 #DP900
The [[View Menu]] in [[Power Query]] contains tools for data profiling.
[[Column Quality]] shows percentages within a column across categories 'valid', 'error', 'empty'.
[[Column Distribution]] provides a sample distribution of the data contained within a column, e.g. distinct vs unique values in a column.
[[Column Profile]] provides a holistic view of the data, including column statistics such as count, errors, distinct and unique values, and minimum and maximum values.

Enhancing data structures in PowerBI includes making column and query names human-readable and consistent, assigning appropriate datatypes to columns, and changing the structure of tables by [[Merging [[Queries]]]] or [[Appending [[Queries]]]] #PL300 #DP900 #Definition

[[Left outer join]] - all from first, only matching from second.
[[Right outer join]] - all from second, only matching from first.
[[Full outer join]] - all rows from both.
[[Inner join]] - only matching rows.
[[Left Anti-join]] - rows only in the first (eliminates matching rows with the second table).
[[Right Anti-join]] - rows only in the second (eliminates matching rows with the first).
All columns from the first table, plus only matching columns from the second.
All rows from both tables.
All columns from the second table, only matching columns from the first.
Produces a table with only matching rows between the two tables.
Produces rows only in the first table, eliminating matching rows with the second table.
Produces rows only in the second table, eliminating matching rows with the first table.

> Sliding windows, output events only for points in time when the content of the window actually changes. In other words, when an event enters or exits the window. So, every window has at least one event. Events can belong to more than one sliding window. #Definition
Window function that outputs events only for points in time when the content of the window actually changes, and where the same events can belong to more than one window. #QuizQuestion #DP203
Source: [Window Functions in Stream Analytics - DEV Community](https://dev.to/frosnerd/window-functions-in-stream-analytics-1m6c)
Accessed: [[May 8th, 2022]]
![](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/firescript-577a2.appspot.com/o/imgs%2Fapp%2FDP900concepts%2FxXP0xIMxYj.gif?alt=media&token=2ffed49a-7933-42a5-b9e8-8a08c377e3c3)

```sql
/* Alert me whenever a topic is mentioned more than 3 times in under 10 sec: */
SELECT Topic, COUNT(*)
FROM TwitterStream TIMESTEAMP BY CreatedAt
GROUP BY Topic, SlidingWindow(second, 10)
HAVING COUNT(*) >= 3```

> Hopping window functions hop forward in time by a fixed period. It may be easy to think of them as Tumbling windows that can overlap and be emitted more often than the window size. Events can belong to more than one Hopping window result set. To make a Hopping window the same as a Tumbling window, specify the hop size to be the same as the window size.
Source: [Window Functions in Stream Analytics - DEV Community](https://dev.to/frosnerd/window-functions-in-stream-analytics-1m6c)
Accessed: [[May 8th, 2022]]
![](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/firescript-577a2.appspot.com/o/imgs%2Fapp%2FDP900concepts%2Fh_VHJ3bE0M.gif?alt=media&token=45138704-7f58-4937-93e1-8eb45ac14d77)

```sql
-- Every 5 sec give me the count of Tweets over last 10 sec:
SELECT System.Timestamp() as WindowEndTime, Topic, COUNT(*) AS Count
FROM TwitterStream TIMESTAMP BY CreatedAt
GROUP BY Topic, HoppingWindow(second,10,5)```

A session window begins when the first event occurs. If another event occurs within the specified timeout from the last ingested event, then the window extends to include the new event. Otherwise if no events occur within the timeout, then the window is closed at the timeout. If events keep occurring within the specified timeout, the session window will keep extending until maximum duration is reached. Windows have a variable length, unlike in other window functions #Fact
Source: [Window Functions in Stream Analytics - DEV Community](https://dev.to/frosnerd/window-functions-in-stream-analytics-1m6c)
Accessed: [[May 8th, 2022]]

```sql
SELECT Country, Count(*) AS Count
FROM ClickStream TIMESTAMP BY CreatedAt
GROUP BY Country, SessionWindow(second, 5, 10)```

>  Partitioning type that involves creating tables with fewer columns and using additional tables to store the remaining columns. #QuizQuestion #DP203 #Definition
You should consider **vertical partitioning** of your table if your columns have different access pattern: some columns are often read and (almost) never updated, others are often updated. #UseCase

Relatively slow-moving data (product name, description, and price) can be separated from the more dynamic data (stock level and last ordered date). Slow moving data is a good candidate for an application to cache in memory.
Sensitive data can be stored in a separate partition with additional security controls.
Vertical partitioning can reduce the amount of concurrent access that's needed.
Advantages of **vertical partitioning**: #Fact
Source: [Data partitioning guidance - Azure Architecture Center | Microsoft Docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/architecture/best-practices/data-partitioning)

> Database operation that will update an existing row if a specified value already exists in a table, and insert a new row if the specified value doesn’t already exist. #QuizQuestion #DP203 #Definition

It is best to use [UpsertRequest](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.xrm.sdk.messages.upsertrequest) only when you aren’t sure if the record exists. That is, when you aren’t sure if you should call a [CreateRequest](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.xrm.sdk.messages.createrequest) or an [UpdateRequest](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.xrm.sdk.messages.updaterequest) operation. There is a performance decrease in using [UpsertRequest](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.xrm.sdk.messages.upsertrequest) versus using [CreateRequest](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.xrm.sdk.messages.createrequest). #Fact

Power BI (Business Intelligence) is a business analytics service that delivers insights for analyzing data. It can share those insights through data visualizations which make up reports and dashboards to enable fast, informed decisions. Power BI scales across an organization, and it has built-in governance and security allowing businesses to focus on using data more than managing it.You can consider Power BI as the analysis and insights leg of Microsoft Power Platform. It takes business data and allows you to display it in ways that makes the most sense to users. A Power BI dashboard could potentially replace a standing meeting to report out on company metrics such as sales data, progress against goals, or employee performance. {{[[r/moved]]}}[*](((Fr4qbc-4m)))

>  Limits sensitive data exposure by masking it to non-privileged users. #QuizQuestion #DP203 #Definition
You set up a dynamic data masking policy in the Azure portal by selecting the Dynamic Data Masking blade under Security in your SQL Database configuration pane. #Fact
Types of masking functions and their logic:
Default:
Use XXXX if the size of the field is less than 4 characters for string data types
Use 0 for numeric data types
Use 01-01-1900 for date/time data types
For XML the document <masked/> is used.
Use an empty value for special data types (timestamp table, hierarchyid, GUID, binary, image, varbinary spatial types).
Credit Card:
Masking method, which exposes the last four digits of the designated fields (XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-1234)
Email:
Masking method, which exposes the first letter and replaces the domain with XXX.com (aXX@XXXX.com)
Random number
Masking method, which generates a random number according to the selected boundaries and actual data types.
Custom text
Masking method, which exposes the first and last characters and adds a custom padding string in the middle.

Type 1 SCD
A Type 1 SCD always reflects the latest values, and when changes in source data are detected, the dimension table data is overwritten.
![](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/firescript-577a2.appspot.com/o/imgs%2Fapp%2FDP900concepts%2FMWlvBOVndl.png?alt=media&token=486a6d39-5def-422f-af37-d4d71e82831b)
Type 2 SCD

A Type 2 SCD supports versioning of dimension members. Often the source system doesn't store versions, so the data warehouse load process detects and manages changes in a dimension table. In this case, the dimension table must use a surrogate key to provide a unique reference to a version of the dimension member. It also includes columns that define the date range validity of the version (for example, **StartDate** and **EndDate**) and possibly a flag column (for example, IsCurrent) to easily filter by current dimension members.
![](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/firescript-577a2.appspot.com/o/imgs%2Fapp%2FDP900concepts%2FD8BZnFLxOu.png?alt=media&token=e1ccb88a-a5c9-4143-a872-d24a407e9fde)
Type 3 SCD

A Type 3 SCD supports storing two versions of a dimension member as separate columns. The table includes a column for the current value of a member plus either the original or previous value of the member.
![](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/firescript-577a2.appspot.com/o/imgs%2Fapp%2FDP900concepts%2FbZ8EDd7xXR.png?alt=media&token=d86ef136-dd0b-4f00-8c08-cfb7f8de6d28)
Type 6 SCD

A Type 6 SCD combines Type 1, 2, and 3. When a change happens to a Type 2 member you create a new row with appropriate **StartDate** and **EndDate**. In Type 6 design you also store the current value in all versions of that entity so you can easily report on the current value or the historical value.
![](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/firescript-577a2.appspot.com/o/imgs%2Fapp%2FDP900concepts%2F1ZUCyCQsoL.png?alt=media&token=4aef2d8f-d6d0-49e9-b8e7-6225c3a579a7)

Source: [Choose between slowly changing dimension types - Learn | Microsoft Docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/modules/populate-slowly-changing-dimensions-azure-synapse-analytics-pipelines/3-choose-between-dimension-types)

Power BI (Business Intelligence) is a business analytics service that delivers insights for analyzing data. It can share those insights through data visualizations which make up reports and dashboards to enable fast, informed decisions. Power BI scales across an organization, and it has built-in governance and security allowing businesses to focus on using data more than managing it.You can consider Power BI as the analysis and insights leg of Microsoft Power Platform. It takes business data and allows you to display it in ways that makes the most sense to users. A Power BI dashboard could potentially replace a standing meeting to report out on company metrics such as sales data, progress against goals, or employee performance. {{[[∆]]:3+2}}
